abstract.p: Friends of Irvington (NY) Public Library will present panel discussion on presidency, politics and the press featuring former CBS and CNN senior producer Richard Cohen and Time magazine editor Barrett Seaman and New York Times deputy editorial page editor Philip M Boffey as panelists; photo (By the Way column) (S)

block.p: Just in time for Election Day, the Friends of the Irvington Public Library will present a panel discussion today at 4 p.m. titled ''The Presidency, Politics and the Press: Informing or Influencing Voters?'' featuring some of Irvington's most high-profile media types.

The panel will include Richard Cohen, former senior producer for CBS and CNN; Barrett Seaman, special projects editor at Time magazine, and Philip M. Boffey, deputy editorial page editor of The New York Times.

Just in time for Election Day, the Friends of the Irvington Public Library will present a panel discussion today at 4 p.m. titled ''The Presidency, Politics and the Press: Informing or Influencing Voters?'' featuring some of Irvington's most high-profile media types.

The panel will include Richard Cohen, former senior producer for CBS and CNN; Barrett Seaman, special projects editor at Time magazine, and Philip M. Boffey, deputy editorial page editor of The New York Times.

''Miraculously we were able to get all these people together at the same time and the same place,'' said Margot Hart, president of the organization, who described the panelists as all ''friends of the Friends.''
Topics will include the changing role of the press in politics and how political parties present themselves to the media in an age of hype and spin.
The event is free and open to the public and will be at the library, at 12 Astor Street.
